data.title: A Selection of Questions and Answers Attributed to Theodore of Mopsuestia: Foreword, Text and Translation
data.abstractNote: The publication aims to introduce into scientific circulation a collection of questions and answers attributed to Theodore of Mopsuestia, touching on basic issues of Christian dogmatics. This article contains the text of 63 questions and their solutions from the manuscript Brit. Lib. mss. syr. 9; thus, we believe, this is the complete text of the collection, part of which (36 questions and answers) was published by Alphonse Mingana in 1919 from another manuscript Harris Cod. syr. 146 that was considered lost. As will be shown in the publication, this manuscript did not perish and ended up in the Mingana collection under the number syr. 108. In addition to Theodore of Mopsuestia, whose direct authorship we dispute, the text contains questions attributed to Dāḏīšō‘ of Qatar, Joseph Ḥazzāyā, Basil of Caesarea and Gregory of Nyssa, as well as a fragment of the eschatological prayer of Serapion and a citation from Jacob of Edessa.
